09:00 <vmassol> good morning  
09:00 <vmassol> trying to understand why the blog test I moved is failing in platform  
09:01 <vmassol> ah I know  
09:01 <vmassol> fixing  
09:11 <vmassol> (I need to find how to get the wysiwyg editor)  
09:12 <D-Spair> has quit

09:34 <vmassol> trying to find where in the code we decide to edit in wysiwyg or not when the editor is not set in an xclass property or in a user's profile  
09:35 <vmassol> ah I have an idea, checking something  
09:39 <vmassol> hmm no, I thought maybe it was because I was logged in with superadmin  
09:44 <vmassol> found the place TextAreaClass.isWysiyg() now need to debug  
09:51 <DarkKnightCZ> Anybody has an idea how to craft ImageConfig from DoubleClickEvent on image in GWT? (like it's done in onImageEdit() in org.xwiki.gwt.wysiwyg.client.plugin.image.ImagePlugin, just without the need of selecting the image)  
10:01 <vmassol> ok found the reason  
10:05 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:25 <DarkKnightCZ> mflorea: Hi, i've got one question about GWT, I want to implement something like MacroController for Image plugin (i.e. you can edit the image with double-click without the need of selecting the image), i just have troubles crafting proper ImageConfig (since the image isn't selected, the code in ImagePlugin.onImageEdit() returns null)... any ideas how to obtain proper JSON image representation?  
10:37 <mflorea> DarkKnightCZ: You could select the image on double click before calling onImageEdit()  
10:37 <mflorea> it's quite easy to do this using the selection manager  
10:47 <vmassol> ok blog test should work fine now  
11:16 <DarkKnightCZ> mflorea: thanks, something like this? http://pastebin.com/XbXGsDeP  
11:22 <mflorea> I don't understand this line:  
11:22 <mflorea> s.selectAllChildren(doc.getParentNode());  
11:22 <mflorea> you need to check if the event target element is an image (img tag) and if so then select it  
11:23 <mflorea> s.selectNode(image)  
11:23 <mflorea> (or something like that, I don't remember the exact API)  
11:24 <mflorea> i.e. if the user has double clicked on an image then select that image element and trigger the edit image wizard  
11:26 <cjd> has quit  
11:35 <DarkKnightCZ> mflorea: okay, thanks, i will try to figure it out
